page.title: 09Buildings around Park Cross.
page.content: There are ten buildings listed by the Department of the Enviroment as being of special{architectural or historical {interest}in the survey area.Seven of these are 18th. century farmhouses. Swainston Manor is also listed. Across the road from Manor stands another listed building, the Temple. It was built in the 18th.century to look like a Greek temple and to provide a view from the Manor.Two other{interesting {buildings}are the Bowcombe Methodist Chapel and the old railway station at Watchingwell.The chapel stands in open country and it was opened in 1908,by the Mayoress of Newport.Today it still serves a small congregation and provides a Sunday School and Youth Club for the area. The old station was opened in 1889 as a private halt serving Swainston on the Freshwater line,it is now a private house.
